text: No other has such mastery over the Djinn as the great Sultan Jaffar.
What an honour to serve and die by the orders of the mighty Sultan.
Those on the high seas are promised plunder, otherwise there'd be scarce men who would join at all.
The undead make for useful troops, but they make for poor company.
Submit to their gracious will, so we may serve them in this life and the next.
From slaves to beggars, all can now be laid to rest in the Necropolis so that they may serve their God for all eternity.
Let us renew our undying pledge to Tutankhanut as our nomad forefathers once did.
Cover yourself with the glory of the sultan and you may earn your freedom.
Learn from your past to better your future.
Though the Askar have a strong sense of camaraderie with their leader, having a ceremony for those worthy can make them utterly devoted.
Overseen by the Dervishers the prayers and rites are performed before the body is washed and then taken to the Tower of Silence where the carrion birds feast.
Together we stand and fight, as equals, as brothers.
Any riddle of the world may be solved through reason and numbers, as taught by the great scholar al-Kharazim.
They are not monsters, merely beings shrouded in misunderstanding and fear.
Our future lies in the mind, protected by the sword.
No other can rival the majesty of our buildings, and through our writings we can create bigger, more elaborate structures faster than ever.
It is most honourable to die defending your homeland and the Sultan's glory.
There is much honour and tradition in the Arabyan bow.
Hit them and hit them again and keep doing so until they are either dead or run.
Suliman became renowned as a deadly, exotic warrior across not only his native Araby but the Old World too. Though he is seen as traitor to some for his Bretonnian ties.
Nepotism is a sickness that can bring down even the mightiest of Empires. Let the greatest serve you rather than us serve the weak.
An encyclopedia of medical texts that will serve our peoples for eons and ensure our finest veterans can keep fighting.

The chosen one, not an Arabyan but a foreigner, a man of the Empire but this does not stop him from being widely revered across Araby and the Old World. Now many study his countless battles and heroism.
We will be the envy of our successors and will go down as the greatest of our people.
A collection of Arabyan myths and legends, it's readers inspired to join its pages.
Some would lock these maps away in gilded halls. I say we use them to chart our own destiny.
We can learn much from the study of our forefathers and the Priest Kings.
What secrets lie in the blood scrawl, just try to not let them consume you or maybe do...
Legendary order of assassins, renowned and feared across Araby. Your throat will be slit long before you ever catch wind of them.
An ingenious timepiece that proved to be vital for the Arabyan shipping lanes. It involves bonding a genie to the device, doomed to mark every heartbeat of its eternal imprisonment.
How to strike man and beast from the shadows, it may not be honourable but it is often fatal.
Victory can be gained not only on the battlefield. We shall see our enemies hunger and thirst before they ever raise a blade to us.
Subjected to military drills since early manhood, all citizens must train in the disciplines and honour of warfare.
Many stories of bloody war that even the wisest of despots can learn from.
We are the line between those that seek to destroy us and our families. If we are to turn and flee we will be lucky to escape with just lashes.
We will decorate our camp with their entrails.
The camel is a mighty creature that can bear the weight of more than just cargo. Those that whimper under the burden of armour are slain on sight.

The author, in the service of the Sultan of Copher, was not only a powerful Arabyan sorcerer but a cruel and feared spymaster. His writing included how to torture those with the use of magic to great effect.
Considered one of the best sorcerers, the Mullah was a famous and revered Arabyan warrior. His many teachings are used to this day even in ways he might not condone.

The leader of the most influential chaos cult in all of Araby, made infamous for the portal to the Chaos realms they constructed. They managed to scrawl their knowledge in blood before being possessed by an agent of Tzeentch.
Through selective breeding, we can rear Elephants that rival even Norscan Mammoths.
It is said that there is no man more disturbed, evil and vile than the Arabyan necromancer known as Har-Ak-Iman who penned this cursed book.
True power lies in the ancient runes of Nehekhara.
